EPTIFIBATIDE

  • Indications and doses
  • Pregnancy
  • Hepatic impairment
  • Renal impairment
  • Contra indications
  • Side effects
  • Cautions
  • Monitoring requirements
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

In combination with aspirin and unfractionated heparin for the prevention of early myocardial infarction in patients with unstable angina or non-ST-segment-elevation myocardial infarction and with last episode of chest pain within 24 hours (specialist use only),

Initially by intravenous injection

  • For adults
    Initially 180 micrograms/kg, then (by intravenous infusion) 2 micrograms/kg/minute for up to 72 hours (up to 96 hours if percutaneous coronary intervention during treatment).

Advice when patient is pregnant

Manufacturer advises use only if potential benefit outweighs risk—no information available.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Avoid in severe liver disease—increased risk of bleeding.

Advice regarding renal impairment

Reduce infusion to 1 microgram/kg/minute if eGFR 30–50 mL/minute/1.73 m2.

Avoid if eGFR less than 30 mL/minute/1.73 m2.

Contra indications

  • Abnormal bleeding within 30 days
  • aneurysm
  • arteriovenous malformation
  • haemorrhagic diathesis
  • history of haemorrhagic stroke
  • increased INR
  • increased prothrombin time
  • intracranial disease
  • major surgery or severe trauma within 6 weeks
  • neoplasm
  • severe hypertension
  • stroke within last 30 days
  • thrombocytopenia

Known side effects

General side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: Bleeding manifestations,

veryRare: Anaphylaxis, rash,

Cautions regarding administration

  • Discontinue if emergency cardiac surgery necessary
  • discontinue if intra-aortic balloon pump necessary
  • discontinue if thrombolytic therapy necessary
  • risk of bleeding—discontinue immediately if uncontrolled serious bleeding

Monitoring requirements

Patient parameters

Measure baseline prothrombin time, activated partial thromboplastin time, platelet count, haemoglobin, haematocrit and serum creatinine.

Monitor haemoglobin, haematocrit and platelets within 6 hours after start of treatment, then at least once daily.

Prepared medicinal forms of EPTIFIBATIDE

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Solution for injection
Solution for infusion
